title: vLLM - GPU, CPU & KV Cache Resource Health
_comment: Dashboard focused on GPU utilization, KV cache occupancy, CPU usage, swap/offload behavior, prefix cache efficiency, and global process health.

panels.title: KV Cache Usage (%)
panels._comment: Percentage of GPU KV cache currently used.
panels._interpretation: If > 80%: high KV saturation → risk of preemptions. If < 60%: system is safe.

panels.title: GPU KV Cache Blocks (Used vs Total)
panels._comment: GPU blocks indicate how many KV cache blocks are allocated on GPU.
panels._interpretation: If used approaches total: GPU KV nearly full. If CPU blocks increase: swap/offload started.

panels.title: CPU Offload (GB)
panels._comment: Amount of KV cache offloaded to CPU when GPU cache is full.
panels._interpretation: If > 0: GPU is full → model is using CPU memory for KV cache, slowing down decoding.

panels.title: Swap Space (Bytes)
panels._comment: Configured swap space for KV offload.
panels._interpretation: If swap space is too small: KV cache will overflow → errors. If used but CPU offload stays low: swap is safe.

panels.title: Prefix Cache Hit-Rate (%)
panels._interpretation: If > 70%: excellent cache reuse. If < 20%: prompts too unique → prefix cache useless.

panels.title: Prefix Cache: Hits & Queries / sec
panels._comment: Shows how often prefix cache is queried, and how often it succeeds.
panels._interpretation: If queries ↑ but hits stay flat: prefix cache mismatches. If hits follow queries: good reuse.

panels.title: GPU Preemptions / sec
panels._comment: Preemptions happen when KV cache or GPU throughput is insufficient.
panels._interpretation: If > 0: eviction or throttling → GPU fully saturated → increase GPU memory or reduce batch size.

panels.title: GPU Preemptions / sec
panels._comment: Indicates GPU overload or KV cache saturation.
panels._interpretation: If > 0: eviction or throttling → GPU fully saturated.

panels.title: CPU Usage (Cores Used)
panels._interpretation: If > 1.0: more than 1 full CPU core used → heavy tokenization or offload. If < 0.2: normal.

panels.title: Process Memory (RSS)
panels._comment: Real memory used by the vLLM process.
panels._interpretation: If always rising: memory leak likely. If stable: healthy.

panels.title: Process Virtual Memory
panels._comment: Total virtual memory used by the process.
panels._interpretation: Monotonic increase = possible memory leak. Stable = OK.
